locutie.beschrijving: A narrative exposition of Israel's wilderness complaints and God's response, paralleled with modern consumerist anxieties (drugs, guns, safety).
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher engages the 'skipped' verses of divine anger and uses the Hebrew narrative structure to frame the human condition.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the reality of the human condition and the character of God, with a late shift toward promising.
voorbeelden: God asserts that the demands of Israel for more meat are really a sign of mistrust.
The story attests that God is indeed adequate for us.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To provoke self-reflection on greed and to provide a tentative comfort in God's faithfulness.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the word's efficacy.

voorbeelden: The Bible is the story of the odd people...
The wilderness in the Bible is a place without viable life supports.
God has lost patience with Moses.
We must take care not to ask for too many quail.
I do not know any of you.
I imagine that God would stuff quail...
God has power and readiness to feed us and sustain us.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The promises are mostly described in the third person rather than directly spoken to the hearer.

voorbeelden: It is true in our life.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher remains a commentator rather than a herald of a new reality.

indicatoren: Theological description of God's character in the 3rd person.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a biblical drama rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the Gospel to the 'you'.

voorbeelden: God does indeed have power for our toughest circumstance.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's own imagination and lack of knowledge of the congregation.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Mostly in the hypothetical 'You want meat?' section or late-sermon application.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Israel, Pharaoh, and God's actions in the past.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High. It treats the text as an object of study.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about consumerism and God.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Description of anxiety) -> Directive (We must take care).
voorbeelden: The story attests... We must take care not to ask for too many quail.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'must' is not preceded by a 'you are forgiven' or 'you are sustained'.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: We live in a time when we wonder... We must take care...

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a brilliant social and biblical commentary but remains 'talking about' God and the world rather than God speaking to the people.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: You want safety? I will give you safety... a bottomless pit of fear.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates a powerful 'Aha' moment regarding modern idols.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The story attests that God is indeed adequate.
zwakke_punten.probleem: It describes adequacy rather than bestowing it.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an event of 'insight' but not necessarily a sacramental event of 'encounter'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'Toezegging' (Promise) that binds God to the hearer in the present moment.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is a character in the story being told, not the speaker of the sermon.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a wise observer/teacher rather than an ambassador.
tekstueel_bewijs: I imagine that God would stuff quail...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's imagination.

sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: The 'quail up the nose' imagery is epiphanic, but the resolution is constative.
tekstueel_bewijs: Whether Godâ€™s word will come true or not.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'was' verbs; needs more 'I [God] promise' or 'I [Preacher] declare'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The story attests that God is indeed adequate for us.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In your wilderness, God says to you: 'I am your adequacy. I will sustain you.'
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a report about God to a promise from God.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is framed as a question or a possibility ('We shall see').
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the authority of the office to announce God's faithfulness.
voorbeeldzinnen: Hear the word of the Lord: He will not leave you to your anxieties.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Overuse of 'we' and 'they' creates a collective distance.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' to pierce the individual conscience and heart.
voorbeeldzinnen: You have signed on with Jesus, and today He feeds you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative 'We must take care' feels like a heavy burden because the indicative 'God is faithful' was only a description.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Make the faithfulness a declarative reality first.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant and exegetically sharp. By shifting from 'talking about' the text to 'performing' the text's promise, it would move from a lecture to a sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (I don't know you); SAT focuses on the 'illocutionary force' of the promise.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric focuses on the persuasion of the 'quail' imagery; SAT focuses on whether the 'word of promise' is actually delivered.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the preacher's skepticism ('We shall see') actually undermines the illocutionary force of the Gospel.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God has power and readiness to feed us.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of Brueggemann-style prophetic imagination which is high on locutionary brilliance but often stays in the assertive/constative realm.
